<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hunter's Sanctum](/Feats.aspx?ID=3476) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 28</row>

**Archetype** [Undead Slayer](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=174)

**Prerequisites**
[Undead Slayer Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3474)

</column>

---

You establish a safe house where you can prepare for your hunt. The sanctum is roughly the size of a 20-foot cube. This sanctum is in a location you have access to and can be part of a larger structure, such as the basement of a temple or hidden room of a library. Setting up or moving your sanctum takes a week of downtime. Your sanctum protects objects and people inside it from magical detection and the prying eyes of [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). This has the effects of [_nondetection_](/Spells.aspx?ID=209), using your [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) modifier for the [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) DC and half your level rounded up for the counteract level. Additionally, undead attempting to locate the entrance to your sanctum via mundane Perception must succeed against either your Religion DC or the normal DC to find the sanctum, whichever is higher.
name: Hunter's Sanctum
